Okay, don’t take this the wrong way, but you aren’t really communicating your current situation or the issue you are having. Maybe you can write out this a bit more into a document and then we can review it and talk more.

That being said — It sounds like you need to create contacts for these users in HubSpot. Then enroll them in a workflow to email them. If you want to use workflows to send emails, they are a 1:1 relationship. Contact workflows trigger on contact property updates. So if you wanted to email someone on X days later, you would create a contact, or update a contact in HubSpot on a date property. For discussion, lets say this is “Send Email Date”, you would push todays date into that contact. Then a workflow on that date or X days after date, you could send this email.

It also seems like the biggest issue you have is your data source. It might be worth exporting those as CSV files of the objects and importing them. Once they are imported, then you can build out the workflows you need to associate the records to each other, and then you can look to improve upon them. It might be worth not worrying about the sync right now until you get the base of this up. Diving into the deep end on this stuff can really get you into the weeds.
